title: Calories in Chilies
meta_description: Discover calories in chilis per 100g, including carbs, protein, fat, fiber, and tips for common varieties like jalapeños or red chilies.
assumptions: Raw, fresh chili peppers (e.g., red or jalapeño variety); no added oils or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chili type, ripeness, growing conditions, and preparation; check sources for specific varieties.

quick_answer.text: 100g of raw chili peppers provide about 40 kcal and 1.9g protein.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of chilies?
faqs.a: About 40 kcal for raw fresh chili peppers.
They have moderate carbs at 8.8g per 100g, mostly from natural sugars.
Yes, around 1.5g dietary fiber per 100g, aiding digestion.
Approximately 1.9g protein per 100g, low but nutrient-dense.

faqs.q: How do cooking methods affect calories in chilies?
faqs.a: Raw is lowest; frying or drying increases calories due to oil or concentration.
